data.Name: Destroyer Of Light, Celestial Wizard
data.Description: In the year 2012, Destroyer of Light was formed in the city of Austin, TX. From thebeginning, Destroyer of Light set out to stay busy and get their name out there releasing 4 LPs, 2 EPs, and a split in a span of 10 years. Also, they have toured the US many times, played festivals like Psycho California, Southwest Terror Fest, Shadow Woods, toured with Pallbearer, and made their first appearance in Europe in 2019. Over the last two years, the band spent most of their time writing and recording two albums worth of material that have yet to be released. However, touring has always been a big part of their life, and they are ready to get back on the road deliver their brand of melodic doom metal to the fans. Give in to sonic lust, turn off your head.

data.Name: Destroyer
data.Bio: Destroyer is a Canadian rock band from Vancouver, British Columbia fronted by singer-songwriter Dan Bejar and formed in 1995. Destroyer songs are characterized by abstract, poetic lyrics and idiosyncratic vocals. The band's discography draws on a variety of musical influences, resulting in albums that can sound markedly distinct from one another; in Bejar's words, "That's kind of my goal: to start from scratch every time." 1996â€“2001 We'll Build Them a Golden Bridge, Destroyer's 1996 debut, is made up of sixteen lo-fi home-recordings. Read more on Last.fm

data.Name: Destroyer of Light
data.Bio: Austin-based doom band, Destroyer of Light, formed in the beginning of 2012. Each member coming from different bands wanted create slow, heavy, riff-induced music and bring it to the masses. Gathering influences from a variety of different styles, each member brings their flavor to the table, and the music speaks for itself. Destroyer of Light is a 4-piece band consisting of Steve Colca on guitars/vocals, Keegan Kjeldsen on lead guitar, Mark Mars on bass, and Kelly "Penny" Turner on drums. Read more on Last.fm
